root.name: Spot Detector
root.description:
Spot detector detects and counts spots.
- Detects spots in noisy images 2D/3D. - Depending on objective, spots can be nuclei, nucleus or cell - Versatile input: sequence or batch of file. - Detects spot in specific band/channel. - Multi band labeling: automaticaly creates ROIs from one band and count in the same or an other band. - Filters detection by size. - Sort detection by ROIs - Output data in XLS Excel files: number of detection by ROIs, and each detection location and size. - Outputs withness image with ROIs and detection painted on it. - Outputs binary detection image. - Displays detections - Displays tags
root.author: fab - Fabrice de Chaumont
root.changelog:
- Version 1.6.0.2 Date 2016-10-24 14:44:31
batch file import fixed with new kernel version
- Version 1.6.0.1 Date 2016-02-10 13:29:44
New GUI New default export
- Version 1.6.0.0 Date 2015-05-05 17:24:36
You can now specify a new detector from an third party plugin
- Version 1.5.0.8 Date 2015-02-12 18:22:23
Fix: The append to xls file is re-working
- Version 1.5.0.7 Date 2014-12-04 15:21:10
Minor fix for test purposes
- Version 1.5.0.6 Date 2014-06-10 18:02:31
Little Change in vtkRendering
- Version 1.5.0.5 Date 2014-05-19 18:16:25
Minor fix to comply with new VTK lib.
- Version 1.5.0.4 Date 2014-04-25 14:10:32
XLS export is now using XLSUtil instead of XLSManager
- Version 1.5.0.3 Date 2014-04-24 17:33:30
Added: some code to obtain more explicit bug reports
- Version 1.5.0.2 Date 2014-04-07 12:03:46
Fix the ROI export in 3D: some ROIs were not properly set in Z.
- Version 1.5.0.1 Date 2014-03-13 16:45:53
minor fix: renaming bands to channels
- Version 1.5.0.0 Date 2014-03-07 18:21:54
- Now exports spots as ROIs (named spot #number) - Threshold in wavelet detector is now named sensitivity - The approximative size of the objects detected by each scale is now displayed - The binary stack output are now saved in 1 file instead of multiple files - The filtering (range of size in pixel) is now fixed - The interval graphical component is removed - Force 2D wavelets for 3D is now functional
- Version 1.4.1.9 Date 2013-12-05 13:11:11
Minor fix
- Version 1.4.1.8 Date 2013-12-04 11:15:34
Improved: If the sequence has no file name, the swimming pool output takes its name as a label.
- Version 1.4.1.7 Date 2013-12-03 14:58:59
max size for spot filtering is now 3000 instead of 300
- Version 1.4.1.6 Date 2013-07-12 15:58:18
- Added: display: option to display detection index (not displayed by default)
- Version 1.4.1.5 Date 2013-06-15 16:04:05
- Automatic creation of ROI now creates named roi with AREA# to find them easialy in the excel output file.
- Version 1.4.1.4 Date 2013-04-23 15:41:22
Added the support of ROIs for scripts using the object UDWTWavelet
- Version 1.4.1.3 Date 2013-02-05 17:34:36
add a class to call the wavelet in an easy manner from scripts
- Version 1.4.1.2 Date 2013-01-28 10:29:00
Minor change
- Version 1.4.1.1 Date 2012-11-13 15:28:05
The automatic generation of ROI can now dilate found ROIs
- Version 1.4.1.0 Date 2012-10-15 13:53:56
- Memory consumption reduced
- Version 1.4.0.7 Date 2012-08-23 17:32:38
- fix: The WAT value could be false if no ROI was present in the sequence and the WAT with ROIs enabled.
- minor changes to fit integration in protocols.
- Version 1.4.0.6 Date 2012-06-15 16:13:37
New XML Features: -Export tags (in a way Excel can manage it) -Export date time of image processing.
New ROI/Batch feature: -New ROIFromFixedSequence: for a batch, you can now set a set of ROI from an active sequence and then apply those ROI(s) to all the batch.
- Version 1.4.0.5 Date 2012-06-14 18:23:10
minor bugfix.
- Version 1.4.0.4 Date 2012-06-14 18:19:33
- Automatic generation of ROIs now works in batch mode
- Version 1.4.0.3 Date 2012-06-14 17:54:12
New preProcessor: mean of channel in images.
- Version 1.4.0.2 Date 2012-06-04 15:47:05
improved: faster save of binary image
- Version 1.4.0.1 Date 2012-05-11 10:15:34
-XML output fields added: file name and folder -fix minor error if no sequence is selected as input -debug output log removed
- Version 1.4.0.0 Date 2012-05-10 14:56:08
New: XML export. See doc for details.
- Version 1.3.0.1 Date 2011-12-07 16:06:18
update to fit with new detection data structure
- Version 1.3.0.0 Date 2011-11-23 17:12:19
New feature:
You can now use the *create roi from band* functionality to automaticaly create a mask of all the cells, and then perform a spot count per segmented cell.
- Version 1.2.0.4 Date 2011-11-14 10:07:40
Add: Externalisation of the wavelets for external use by other plugins

- Version 1.2.0.2 Date 2011-10-20 10:21:18
Batch improvements (to be continued)
- Version 1.2.0.1 Date 2011-10-06 14:42:31
stable version

- now computes min,max and average intensity. - code cleanup
- Version 1.1.0.6 Date 2011-09-14 14:25:31
minor change
- Version 1.1.0.5 Date 2011-09-14 14:18:46
Fix: Images are now saved at the correct size.
- Version 1.1.0.4 Date 2011-09-13 11:40:19
Fix export

Regression from version 1.1.0.1

Add: link to online documentation.
- Version 1.1.0.1 Date 2011-08-29 15:22:12
improved detection GUI
- Version 1.1.0.0 Date 2011-08-29 13:16:38
Fix: memory leak. Fix: painter are not anymore shared between sequences Fix: binary output has no more strange colors Fix: an error occured if 2 same batch were launch in a row
- Version 1.0.2.11 Date 2011-08-17 11:48:50
- Version 1.0.2.10 Date 2011-06-16 18:07:59
Add x y z t in the xls output

Compatibility with last kernel version 1.0.0.5

Fix some issues due to changes in dependency ConnectedComponents

stable release
- Version 1.0.2.6b Date 2011-03-25 17:17:36
FIX: when the plugin is closed, the detection represented on the sequence are removed too.
- Version 1.0.2.5b Date 2011-03-25 16:46:08
Added: Now exports detections to the swimming pool to communicate with the spot tracker.
- Version 1.0.2.4 Date 2011-03-15 14:25:24
Added: Name of ROI displayed over sequence
- Version 1.0.2.3 Date 2011-03-07 10:11:12

Webcam detection fixed Output fixed

Automatic creation of ROI added. This takes on channel and threshold it to drive the detection in an other channel.
